title: Blood Press. & Cholesterol | 1 of 2
question_text: High Blood Pressure & High Cholesterol: $9$ High Blood Pressure & Normal Cholesterol: $12$ Normal Blood Pressure & High Cholesterol: $11$ Normal Blood Pressure & Normal Cholesterol: $21$ The data above summarizes data about the occurrences of two medical measurements, blood pressure (BP) and cholesterol level, for $53\text{ individuals}$ who were measured at the infirmary of a large steel mill as part of their annual check-up. Given that an individual has normal blood pressure, what is the probability that the individual has normal cholesterol?
